text: Light golden hue with a slight chill haze and a rocky white head. Lovely aromatic nose of citrusy and slightly herbal American hops with a light grassy Germanic touch and a light grainy pilsner malt base. Crisp delightful flavor thats dry and bright, full of floral and citrusy hop flavors and a bright German grassy kiss followed by a blonde crackery malt base that blends with a subtle black pepper and American floral hop tone. Super complex and interesting, delicate yet flavorful and thoughtful.

12-ounce can pours mostly clear pale straw-yellow with generous white head and lacing. Aroma: faint biscuit and lemon. Flavor: biscuit, lemon, slightly bitter finish. Mouthfeel: light-bodied, clean finish. Very chuggable.

Jar at Brewpub. Good aroma. Sweet. Hoppy and grass/straw. Clean yellow gold color, ok head no lace. Moderate bitter Litely sweet flavor. Light body, thin smooth mouthfeel, crisp bitter finish. Solid kolsch. Much needed as Im crawling the south slope and trying not to pass out by 6
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Can.
Clear yellow with a white head.
Spicy, lemony hop aroma.
The flavor is lightly bitter with some dryness. lightly fruity and light bodied.
crisp refreshing easy drinker.

Can. Pours a clear yellow color with white head. Straw, herbal aromas. Straw, earthy, slight corn, slight metallic flavors. Not as good as the Shallow Water kolsch by then that I had last week. Not super great.

draft that poured yellow with white head. nice mild to medium body decent flavor. good pils flavor nice hop punch in the middle and on the end. these beers arent easy to make but they make it easy..delicious.

Can (Feb 16, 2017 canning).

Head is initially small, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting.
Body is light to medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers), with a light note of Smarties candy.

Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Light to medium body, velvety/watery texture, lively carbonation.

A simple, rather bland, and somewhat Americanized example. Its pretty clean, though.

Can at Blue Smoke. Pours a bright hazy yellow body with thick white head. Nose is crisp fruity hops and grains. Mouthfeel is light bodied with a crisp, dry hopped profile. Refreshing and clean with notes of sweet citrus, grains, and dry hop character.
Crisp and clean. A little grassy and bitter on the finish. Slight sweetness. Easy to drink.

12oz can pours a clear, light gold with some cloudy, white head. Nose is nice, floral, grassy, a little butter but lemon too. Flavor delivers on the promise, simple but well done kolsch is there, light grist, grass, light hop, light soap. Crisp and dry finish. Solid and easy drinker.

Draft to taster at Burial. Looks good; a mostly transparent gold with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells amd tastes of fruity hops and lager yeast with a fairly clean medium light-bodied mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
Can. Pours clear pale yellow with large foamy white head, malty aroma,lightly bitter malty taste, smooth thin body, abrupt finish. Quite smooth and mellow but did not really feel hoppy.
Can at home, excited these folks in NYC now. Gold with white head. Nose is light floral hops some citrus. Tastes lemony, of water crackers, peppery, dusty hops, some grass. Pleasant brew.

12 oz can from Milk and Hops, Chelsea. Clear golden pour with a small, fizzy head and mild lace. Floral and grassy notes, a bit of pepper, some dough, yeast, and herbal notes. Drinks rather bitter, dry for the style. Clean finish. Rather fizzy.

Can in NYC. Pours a super clear deep gold, fluffy off white head. Aroma is hay, grass, grains, light pine, faint musty fruits, yeast. Flavor is clean pale cracker malt, bread, earth, grass, dough. Clean not too hoppy (per name) Kolsch.

Sample at the taproom. The beer is a slightly hazy bright yellow color with a medium white head that burns away steadily to a wispy film. Spotty lacing. Citrus, yeast and malt aroma. Light-bodied with flavors of grassy hops, peppery yeast and biscuit malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a hoppy aftertaste. Decent overall.
Draught at Burial. Very floral and very clear with some nice hoppy notes. Well done overall.
Pale gold with a very slight haze. Peppery hop aroma doesnt really match the description of Simcoe and Centennial, but it is a hop-forward kolsch.
Draft at Churchkey during Savor Week. Clear bright yellow color, white head. Peppery aroma. Taste is white pepper and straw.

Draft at Churchkey for the The Southern Craft Brewer Night: Burial, Fonta Flora, Great Raft, Parish & Wicked Weed. Poured a mostly clear golden yellow color with a small fizzy white head. Aroma was light grassy notes, funky notes. Crisp tasting beer.
Draft. Aroma of lemon tea. Lines of lace. Booming flavors of lemon tartness, a touch of bitter pine and a whiff of something sweet, like sugary lemonade. Finishes stupid dry. Wow.

Taps slightly hazy solar yellow wi a thin eggshell head. Aroma delivers strong, crisp wheaty and citrus notes plus a little pear and a little malt. Flavor features more citrus, as well as a bit of woody hop character, for one tasty Kölsch. Mouthfeel offers decent body and strong, lasting fizz, plus a lemony finish. Signal for one.
